title: New Mass. Dunkin’ facility’s doughnut aroma is overwhelming neighbors
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News A Haverhill resident’s complaint of it smelling "like doughnuts all the time” set off a wave of online comments.
Donuts are displayed for sale inside a Dunkin' Donuts.

Luke Sharrett, Bloomberg A massive new doughnut plant producing about a million pastries a day is drawing complaints in Haverhill, where residents say an overpowering doughnut smell has been drifting into their homes for weeks.

title: Methuen man charged with murdering his mother, a Lawrence teacher
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime A relative of Dominga Romano’s told Telemundo they hadn’t heard from her since Christmas morning, prompting a welfare check and subsequent 911 call Monday.

By Abby Patkin December 30, 2025 | 2:15 PM 2 minutes to read A Methuen man appeared in court Tuesday after he was accused of murdering his mother, a beloved Spanish teacher who taught at Lawrence High School.
Anthony Nunez-Romano, 26, was ordered held without bail after pleading not guilty to murder and two counts of illegally owning a firearm.

title: Patriots’ Stefon Diggs is facing strangulation, assault charges
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Diggs has an arraignment scheduled for Jan.
Stefon Diggs.

title: Truck carrying $400K in lobster stolen after it left Taunton facility
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime CEO of supply chain company says shipment vanished while en route to Costco stores.
Cooked lobsters sit on ice at Woodman's in Essex.

Erin Clark/Globe Staff A truck carrying more than $400,000 worth of lobster meat vanished somewhere between a Taunton warehouse and its Midwest Costco destinations, according to the Indiana-based freight company responsible for the shipment.

title: NFL experts make case for outside MVP candidate, but admit Drake Maye will ‘probably win it’
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "Drake Maye's not the one who put the schedule together.
You put them out there, he knocks them all down.
" Drake Maye during the Patriots win agains the Jets.

title: Suspicious package brings police bomb squad to area near North End; no explosives found
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News Boston police determined the item contained no explosive or hazardous materials.
By Abby Patkin December 30, 2025 | 10:58 AM Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
The Boston Police Department’s bomb squad responded to a neighborhood just outside the North End late Monday night following a call about a suspicious package.

title: Leominster man arrested in connection with wife’s death after police standoff
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime The alleged victim was identified in charging documents as James Marsh’s wife, 62-year-old Ann C.
Marsh.

By Abby Patkin December 30, 2025 | 10:26 AM 2 minutes to read A Leominster man is facing charges in connection with his wife’s death after he allegedly barricaded himself inside his home Friday and spent hours locked in a standoff with police.

title: Mass. has one of the best last-minute New Year’s Eve getaways in the U.S., according to Time Out
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel The destination is "surprisingly doable, even at the last minute.
" First Night fireworks exploded over the Public Garden on New Year’s Eve in Boston.
Jessica Rinaldi / Boston Globe By Kristi Palma December 30, 2025 | 10:16 AM 1 minute to read Who says you need to book New Year’s Eve plans way in advance?

title: Mass. women lured R.I. casino patron to hotel room so man could rob him, police say
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime Investigators allege two Mass.
women lured the victim before a third suspect robbed him at Bally’s Twin River.
Dominyck Sims, 28, of Worcester.

title: Boston man beat elderly neighbor over package mix-up, DA says
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime Prosecutors say the 29-year-old, who has a criminal history, attacked the victim in Mattapan.

A package delivered to the wrong doorstep allegedly triggered a brutal assault, leaving an elderly Boston resident injured and a 29-year-old neighbor facing assault and robbery charges, Suffolk District Attorney Kevin Hayden said.
Prosecutors charged Khalil Muhammad on Tuesday in the Dorchester Division of the Boston Municipal Court with assault and battery on a person over 60 and unarmed robbery.
